page.title: 08THE FARMING YEAR 1
page.content: The farm labour force usually consists of the husband, wife and older children. There is little casual labour as in the past, though at busy times, such as hay-timing, local youngsters from the village are hired. Contracters may undertake some specialised work (e.g. hedging, siloing) at busy times. In winter (January,February) the cows, kept inside, must be milked and fed on proven and hay. The stirks (young stock)and sheep are outside and need extra food especially in bad weather. In spring (March,April) the cows are let out and the farmer is busy with hedge-laying and muck-speading as well as coping with lambing-time. Early summer (May, June) sees him fencing and siloing and attending to cows calving. Calving continues throughout
